that a independent city. The three towns of Chandigarh,

Panchkula shares an airport and a train station with Chandigarh, but has it's own bus stand.
It lies on the Kalka-Ambala road.

Panchkula is 5kms from Chandigarh.

The bus stand of Panchkula is in Sec-5 Panchkula, Panchkula is a very small town and people like to catch buses within the city from bus-stops that are there on all mainroads dividing the sectors.

A bus from Chandigarh to Panchkula costs around 16-20Rs. A taxi costs around 100-150Rs.

There many taxi stands in panchkula, in Sector 14, Sector 8.

Sector 5 of Panchkula has a couple of exotic gardens that mark the greenery of Panchkula. Sector 5 is the heart of city, it almost lies in the centre and is surrounded by 8 sectors.

It has the famous cactus garden. Cactus garden is open from 10am in morning to 5pm. It has a ticket for entry.

Yavnika open-theatre and adjoining park.

Vatika Gardens along with City Fountains.
Panchkula is an upcoming city with a lot of movie theatres and shopping malls in and around the city.

1.Fun Republic in Manimajra, opposite Sector - 7 Panchkula.
2. Shallimaar Mall opposite Sector - 8 Panchkula.
3. Bella Vista opposite Sector 6 & Sector 2 on the Tank Chowk.
4. DT Cinemas IT Park.
5. Paras DownSquare and Adlabs Multiplex, Zirakpur 5 kms from Panchkula.
6.PVR in Chandigarh Industrial Area Phase-I.

(Sector-11), etc.  

Some local restaurants available are:

1.

: Situated in Sector-11 (SCO-25), its the foremost vegetarian family restaurant in Panchkula offering great variety of dishes. North Indian, South Indian and Chinese cuisines are served. Fast food is also available. Cost for two will be Rs.450-500 approximately.
: Also a vegetarian restaurant, present near KC Cinema, Hi5 Multiplex, DLF City Center Mall, Sector 5, Panchkula. It mainly serves South Indian food.

: It is a dine in restaurant specialising in Mughlai and North Indian food. Bar is also available. Average cost for two will be around Rs.1000/-. Its present in HUDA Restaurant Complex, Opposite City Fountain, Sector 5, Panchkula.

Panchkula had many restaurants in its thriving sectors, offering almost every famous cuisine in the world. Apart from these ever busy establishments, many road side vendors can also be seen selling cheap finger snacks like samosas, spring rolls, sandwiches, gol gappas, chat and even chinese food which can be packed for take-away. Though hygiene isn't really a priority for these road side establishments, their popularity isn't lessened. They also see a steady rush of customers daily and also gain many regulars.

There are almost 160-200 places to eat in Panchkula with an average cost of Rs.500 per person.
